decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying early pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp, the deck can repeatedly exile and return key cards, disrupting the opponent's game plan. Fatal Push and Solitude provide removal options while Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk deliver consistent damage. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd can generate additional value by returning creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of creatures with cycling abilities and cards that manipulate graveyards to effectively bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard with Living End, while also having control through counterspells like Force of Negation and disruption with cards like Subtlety. The deck aims to quickly cycle through cards to set up the graveyard for a big Living End play, while also controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck combines synergy between cycling creatures and powerful spells to create a strong combo strategy.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, backed up by powerful spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Static Prison, while also utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory to push through for damage. With mana fixing from lands like Arid Mesa and Flooded Strand, this deck is designed to play threats early and often to put pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By combining cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Solitude to control the board and disrupt the opponent's resources, while also utilizing cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to consistently generate value with enter-the-battlefield effects. The deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot with a mix of disruption and threats, ultimately overwhelming them and securing the victory.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and using creature tutors to cheat out powerful creatures like Allosaurus Rider, Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. By utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform, the deck aims to assemble the Allosaurus Combo and overwhelm the opponent with big threats. The deck also includes protection spells like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. Overall, the key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo without relying on traditional lands. It focuses on using cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to quickly assemble key pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer. Utilizing a mix of counterspells and disruptive cards like Sink into Stupor and Suppression Ray, the deck aims to control the game and protect its combo pieces until it can overwhelm the opponent with a devastating combo finish.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. The goal of the deck is to keep the opponent's threats at bay while generating card advantage with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Meticulous Archive. The deck also aims to lock down the opponent's spells with cards like Orim's Chant and Isochron Scepter. By carefully managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a longer, grindy game.

The deck focuses on using milling cards like Archive Trap, Ruin Crab, and Fractured Sanity to slowly deplete the opponent's library, while utilizing counterspells and removal to control the board. Tasha's Hideous Laughter and Sink into Stupor provide additional mill options, while Surgical Extraction can disrupt the opponent's strategy by removing key cards from their graveyard. The deck also includes card draw with Visions of Beyond and Preordain to maintain hand advantage. Overall, the goal is to mill the opponent out quickly and efficiently while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing you to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and devastating colorless spells. With multiple ways to tutor for UrzaTron lands, along with disruption tools like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, the deck aims to control the game by shutting down opponent's strategies and overwhelming them with large threats. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms provide additional versatility and power, making it difficult for opponents to mount a successful offense.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Gemstone Caverns and Eldrazi Temple to summon powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. Combining cards like Malevolent Rumble and Blade of the Bloodchief to control the board and build up your creatures, along with Tezzeret, Cruel Captain for additional control and card advantage. The deck focuses on creating a strong board presence and overwhelming your opponent with powerful creatures and combo interactions.

This deck utilizes a toolbox of creatures and combo pieces to generate value and control the board. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual, the deck can tutor for specific creatures or ramp into its combo pieces efficiently. The deck includes various utility creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Viscera Seer, along with strong finishers like Marionette Apprentice and Umbral Collar Zealot. With the ability to tutor for key pieces and disrupt opponents with removal and protection, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a 1 vs 1 matchup.

This deck aims to control the game using the UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly and play powerful Eldrazi creatures. It utilizes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also having removal options like Dismember and Kozilek's Command. The deck also includes cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and All Is Dust for board control, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a strong board presence. With a combination of mana ramp and control elements, this deck aims to dominate the late game and secure victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By utilizing cards like Guide of Souls and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to pump up creatures, alongside powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to deal fast, consistent damage to the opponent. Cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach and removal options, while cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison help to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding. The deck also features some control elements with Stubborn Denial and Consign to Memory to help maintain board control. The mana base is diversified to ensure consistent access to all the colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities. The goal is to apply pressure early and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through Lotus Bloom and comboing off with Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage to the opponent. It also includes cards like Stern Scolding and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Cards like Whir of Invention and Thundertrap Trainer help to search for key combo pieces. The deck utilizes a variety of counterspells like Flare of Denial and Disrupting Shoal to protect its combo. Overall, the deck aims to win swiftly by assembling its combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with its powerful spells.

The main concept of this combo landless deck is to quickly assemble pieces that synergize together to achieve a win condition without relying on traditional mana production from lands. Cards like Lotus Bloom help generate mana, while Hydroelectric Specimen, Tameshi Reality Architect, and Thundertrap Trainer work together to create a powerful combo. Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation help protect the combo pieces, with counterspells like Spell Snare and Whir of Invention to control the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a game-winning combo before they can respond effectively.
